The spacious and elegant house belonging to
the Company, which was completed last fall, is
now open and handsomely furnished for the re-
cepton of visitors and boardcrs, under the sti-
perintendence oi the Subscriber.


This WArLnfsG pIAcE is finely situated in
the high aud healthy country, FIVE miles west of
Wilmington, commanding an extensive view OF
the surrounding country, the River Delaware and
the neighborng States. The grounds of the
company afford pleasant and shady promenades,
and are bounded by fine streams.


The virtues of the Waters are those of the pur-
est Chalybeate, according to the analysis or Pro-
fessor Keating Of Philadelphia. They have been
particularly eiiicacious in bilious and other fe-
yers, and are celebrated as a fine tonic.


The vicinity to Wilmington, offers at all times,
access to an excellent markets and the daily in
tercourse by Steam Boat lines between that
place and New-Castle, to and from Philadelphia
and Baltimore, affords facility of communica-
ton not possessed by any other Watering Place.
Parties can be accommodated at short notice
with dinners, collations, Ice creams, &c. &c.


No exertions shall be spared by the Proprietor,
to CRAFTY every want of the visitor to this pleas
ant and salubrious Retreat.


Charges will be moderate.


CHARLES STANLEY.
June 1, 1927. 39-3m.


NIB Carriages, gigs or horses may always

roads, to the neighboring towns, villages, canal,
&c. Horses taken at livery. G.. S.

S7OHN BANCROFT, having removed from


~ Brandywine Bridge, to Providence Facto-
~, Delaware Co. Pa, takes this means to in
form his friends and the public generally, that
he there continues the Carding ofWool, for all
those who are pleased to favor him with their
custom; and that he hopes by strict attention and
punctuality, to merit continuance of pub
lie patronage. lie also takes this opportunity
to inform those to whose favor he was indebted
forwork in this line, while at Brandywihe Bridge,
that all wool left for him to card, atJohn Torbers
Store, or at the soap Factory of Brainton & Ban
croft, Wilmington, or at VIM. M'Cauley's Store,
Brandy vine, will be taken from thence onre ev-
cry week, and, being carded, will be punctually
etunred the week following; hoping, by the
bove arrangement, and punctually in the return
and good performance of the work confided to
him, they may be induced to continue their fa-
yours.

is on a black oak and hickory soil, ina high state
Of cultivation, and equaled by few in the neigh
bourhood;--t is well adapted to all kinds ot
Grasses and Griin.--has on it a young thriving
orchard of about one hundred trees OF choice
fruit; an excellent bottom meadow, through
which runs a never failing stream; and seven til
lages or fields, all under good fence. The i'm
provements are atwo story log dwelling house,
well weather-hoarted outside and lathed and
pastered inside, having three rooms down and
four up stairs, with a first rate cellar under the
whole.-Also, kitchen adjoining, with a pump
of excellent water at the door; stone milk
house and smoke house; frame barn, nearly
new, with excellent stablng underneath, sufi
cient to hold ten or twelve head of horses, be
sides mich COWS, calves, &c. Further descrp
ton is deemed unnecessary, as it is expected
that any wishing to purchase will view the prem
ises, which the subscriber, living thereon, cal
show, and make known the conditions of sale.


JOHN PITNER,

The Proprietor Of Parker's Panacea has the
satisfaction Of laying before the public, the fol
lowing recommendatory notice Of his Medicine
from DR. Edwin A. Atlee, highly respectable
Practitioner in Philadelphia


"Having been requested to state, what expert
ence have had of the efficacy OF Psrkers Pana-
cea, am enabled to say, that three patients,
who have used Of the bottles, presented tor trial,
have evidently derived great benefit The hrst
is respectable female, who labored under ex-
treme scrofclous debility, in which the stomach
participated largely--ts digestive functions be-
ing much dsordered After taking one bottle,
her health was improved---her appetite, diges-
ton and compexion meliorated; and in the use
of the second hottie her convalesence is speedy.
The second is the son of board-nerchant,
who suffers with the hip-disease, scrofulous at
fcction or carries of the neck of the thigh bone.
Previously to the use of Parker's Panacea, he
had habtuay suffered great pain in the affected
part, and his general health was much impaired.
He has taken nearly two bottles, and his parents
say he has been more free Of pain than before,
while his general health is fast improving


The third is Lady, whose disease is supposed
to be Rheumatc-and who has long suffered
with an extensive ulcer of the leg, resisting the
remedies prescribed by two regular and eminent
physicians, who apprehended the loss ofthe limb
by gangrene. BY request, called to see her to-
day; viewed the ulcer, which is now not more
than fourth, in diameter and depth, of what 1t


was originally-is much less swollen, very slight
y painful--and she says she has received more
benefit from the two bottles of Parker's Panacea,


than from any medicine that had been before ad,
ministered.'


i Ifthe above recommendatory notice is calcu


lated to benefit the proprietor it is at his service
/ T.. A. ATLEE.
| Phiiadelphia 5ih mo- so, 1927.

full articles.headline:
HranAy wine Chalybeate


SSpsIlT cyS.
full articles.article:
The spacious and elegant house belonging to
the Company, which was completed last fall, is
now open and handsomely furnished for the re-
cepton of visitors and boardcrs, under the sti-
perintendence oi the Subscriber.


This WArLnfsG pIAcE is finely situated in
the high aud healthy country, FIVE miles west of
Wilmington, commanding an extensive view OF
the surrounding country, the River Delaware and
the neighborng States. The grounds of the
company afford pleasant and shady promenades,
and are bounded by fine streams.


The virtues of the Waters are those of the pur-
est Chalybeate, according to the analysis or Pro-
fessor Keating Of Philadelphia. They have been
particularly eiiicacious in bilious and other fe-
yers, and are celebrated as a fine tonic.


The vicinity to Wilmington, offers at all times,
access to an excellent markets and the daily in
tercourse by Steam Boat lines between that
place and New-Castle, to and from Philadelphia
and Baltimore, affords facility of communica-
ton not possessed by any other Watering Place.
Parties can be accommodated at short notice
with dinners, collations, Ice creams, &c. &c.


No exertions shall be spared by the Proprietor,
to CRAFTY every want of the visitor to this pleas
ant and salubrious Retreat.


Charges will be moderate.


CHARLES STANLEY.
June 1, 1927. 39-3m.


NIB Carriages, gigs or horses may always
be had; and there are delightful rides over good
roads, to the neighboring towns, villages, canal,
&c. Horses taken at livery. G.. S.

full articles.headline: WOOL CARDING.
full articles.article:
S7OHN BANCROFT, having removed from


~ Brandywine Bridge, to Providence Facto-
~, Delaware Co. Pa, takes this means to in
form his friends and the public generally, that
he there continues the Carding ofWool, for all
those who are pleased to favor him with their
custom; and that he hopes by strict attention and
punctuality, to merit continuance of pub
lie patronage. lie also takes this opportunity
to inform those to whose favor he was indebted
forwork in this line, while at Brandywihe Bridge,
that all wool left for him to card, atJohn Torbers
Store, or at the soap Factory of Brainton & Ban
croft, Wilmington, or at VIM. M'Cauley's Store,
Brandy vine, will be taken from thence onre ev-
cry week, and, being carded, will be punctually
etunred the week following; hoping, by the
bove arrangement, and punctually in the return
and good performance of the work confided to
him, they may be induced to continue their fa-
yours.


4thmo. S, 1897. 29-3ul.

full articles.headline: A Valuable Farm for Sale.
full articles.article:
9.7A rs offered TO private sale,a Padta.
ffsssssTsTG& a ble Farm, situated in Pencader
IL Vgss hundred, Newcastle County, Del. a
sz-ssssx - bout mile south of Newark; adjon-
ing iai!ts Of +. H. Iot2beeker, the heirs OF Will
liam Lindsey, dec, Zachariah Jones, and others,
containing lO6 acres, "more or less. his Farm
is on a black oak and hickory soil, ina high state
Of cultivation, and equaled by few in the neigh
bourhood;--t is well adapted to all kinds ot
Grasses and Griin.--has on it a young thriving
orchard of about one hundred trees OF choice
fruit; an excellent bottom meadow, through
which runs a never failing stream; and seven til
lages or fields, all under good fence. The i'm
provements are atwo story log dwelling house,
well weather-hoarted outside and lathed and
pastered inside, having three rooms down and
four up stairs, with a first rate cellar under the
whole.-Also, kitchen adjoining, with a pump
of excellent water at the door; stone milk
house and smoke house; frame barn, nearly
new, with excellent stablng underneath, sufi
cient to hold ten or twelve head of horses, be
sides mich COWS, calves, &c. Further descrp
ton is deemed unnecessary, as it is expected
that any wishing to purchase will view the prem
ises, which the subscriber, living thereon, cal
show, and make known the conditions of sale.


JOHN PITNER,


MAY %, 1927. 57-4t.

full articles.headline: LANES C.. MURCH.
full articles.article:
The Proprietor Of Parker's Panacea has the
satisfaction Of laying before the public, the fol
lowing recommendatory notice Of his Medicine
from DR. Edwin A. Atlee, highly respectable
Practitioner in Philadelphia


"Having been requested to state, what expert
ence have had of the efficacy OF Psrkers Pana-
cea, am enabled to say, that three patients,
who have used Of the bottles, presented tor trial,
have evidently derived great benefit The hrst
is respectable female, who labored under ex-
treme scrofclous debility, in which the stomach
participated largely--ts digestive functions be-
ing much dsordered After taking one bottle,
her health was improved---her appetite, diges-
ton and compexion meliorated; and in the use
of the second hottie her convalesence is speedy.
The second is the son of board-nerchant,
who suffers with the hip-disease, scrofulous at
fcction or carries of the neck of the thigh bone.
Previously to the use of Parker's Panacea, he
had habtuay suffered great pain in the affected
part, and his general health was much impaired.
He has taken nearly two bottles, and his parents
say he has been more free Of pain than before,
while his general health is fast improving


The third is Lady, whose disease is supposed
to be Rheumatc-and who has long suffered
with an extensive ulcer of the leg, resisting the
remedies prescribed by two regular and eminent
physicians, who apprehended the loss ofthe limb
by gangrene. BY request, called to see her to-
day; viewed the ulcer, which is now not more
than fourth, in diameter and depth, of what 1t


was originally-is much less swollen, very slight
y painful--and she says she has received more
benefit from the two bottles of Parker's Panacea,


than from any medicine that had been before ad,
ministered.'


i Ifthe above recommendatory notice is calcu


lated to benefit the proprietor it is at his service
/ T.. A. ATLEE.
| Phiiadelphia 5ih mo- so, 1927.


Sold by JosErn BRINGHuRsr, Druggist and
Chemist, No. 81, Market street Wilmington.
Also, at J. HARLAS's Drug Store, opposite the
Town-Hall Market street.

full articles.headline: TO THE AFFLICTED!
full articles.article:
In Justice to myself, have been induced to
reply to a false and unjustifable attack made
upon me and others by swain, the vender OF a
certain Panacea in this city. do this also, IN or
der to remove from the public mind, the false
impressions which may arise out OF his pompous
and incorrect statement in the public prints
Mr.. Swain wishes to establish the belief, that ne
is the sole patentee of the celebrated Panacea,
upon which he has built his fortues; and not sat
,sGed with asserting this, he goes OH to condemn
all others as spurious and false limitations. Now
nothing is more entirely destitute of TRUTH.
have been acquainted with the OF ORIGINAL RE-
cIpE FROM WHICH SWAIN MAEufAcTUnEs HIS Med
IcINE, ron UPWARDS OF TEN YEARS. 1T WAS Oh
TANNED FROM MY FArHER-IN-LAw, WHO NOW RE-
SIDES IN THE STATE OF NEW YORK, WHO HAS US
ED 1T ron THIRTY YEARS, AND PERFORMED INNu-
MERABLE EXTRAORDINARY CURES WITH ir IN
epcry case where have administered this med-
cine, its powerful virtues have not been known
to fail: this, of itself, and have certificates to
.ubstantiate the fact, would give the lie TO Mr,
3waim's bare assertion. Perfectly satisfied as |
am, with the increasing orders for it, which are
reaching me from various parts OF the Union,
should not have thought it necessary to make
this plain statement of the relative merits OF the
case, had not Mr.. Swain, on one occasion, when
q Lady personally waited on him, to purchase
his PanaceQ, and complained of his extortonate
price, remarking to hn that she couid pufchtse
mine for half the money, advised her not TO take
any Of it for fear it might produce fatal conse
quences, and went on to say that it was not gen
sine. Thousands of persons who are now en-
ioying the blessings of health, established by it
nse will bear me out of this assertion, THAT
"PARKER's REN0yArING VEGETABLE PASAcEA
IS, IN EVERY RESPECT, Equal TO SwAlMs, AN
CAN BE TAKEN IN ALL CASES WHERE HIS mas PhoV
ED EFFIcAclous WITH SECURITY AND FREEDOM
AND I DO SAY, WITHOUT FEAR OF CONTRADICTION
AND CAN EsTA BLIsH THE FACT BEYOND THE Posi-


BIL1Ty OF DouBr-TnAT Ny MEDICINE and IN
ARE ONE Ann THE SAME THING, WITH THE ExcEP
TIoN OF ANY MERcURIAL PRgpARArIoN.


JOHN A. PARKER.

situation. He is acquainted with the ordinary
business of farmer, and would be willing to hire
as such. He is also well acquainted with house
work, cooking, &c. and would suit any one hay.
ing horses to take care of. Satisfactory recon.
mendstion can be gyenby applying at this OF.
fee.

The numbers will be put into one wheel as u
sual-and in the other wheel will be put the pri-
zes above IS, and the drawing to progress i'll the
usual manner. The 5000 prizes of s4 to be a.
wardcd to the tickets, the numbers ofwhich end
with the terminating figure of either of the three
first drawn numbers of different Examinations.
The five dollar prizes 10 be awarded to the tick
cts having the two last figures corresponding
with the two last figures of such number of the
next drawn Of different termination. This mode
will permit the whole lottery to be completed in

1t is particularly beneficial in Reumatisms, its
effects being such as completely to remove the

In all cutaneous diseases, or affections of the
skin, perhaps there is no medicine that has been
more eminently successful. In the early stages
Of Consumption, it will be found of eminent ser.
vice. 1t affords effectual relief in Sylphittitc
and Mercurial Diseases.


Several cases of Jaundice have been radically

Dyspepsia, or indigestion, is taken away by

and for that purpose kept by families to be used
in the CONT ls-.ts incident to the change Of the
seasons


This Medicine is Warranted Genuine, and is
equal 10 any now in use; it is carefully prepared
rom the original Recipe,


BY JOHN A. PARKER.
Directions fer using this Medicine, and certf
Gates from respectable persons who it has rodtc
ally cured of various confirmed diseases, accom-
pany each bottle.


This Panacea has been highly recommended
by many respectable Physicians, and Protessor
in the INTEGRITY Of Pennsylvania. 1t has per
formed remarkable cures, after all the efforts o
experience and skill have failed. A timely use
Of it will prevent Consumptions, as it carries Of
the complaints that terminate in this fatal wild,
spreading disease. 1t is well known fact, tina
more die with this disease than of any other tt
which the human family are exposed. Indeed
it has spread to such alarming extent, and is 81
certain in its operation, when once it has got th
Rscendency, that we cannot betoo careful in nip
ping in the bud the diseases that generate it.


In cases where Mercury has been used, the ef
fects of which remain in the system, it is an nval
liable medicine. 1t restores the constitution Il
its wonted vigor and soundness, and completed
eradicates the evils that attend it, and man
more can bear testimony to its good effects i
this particular.
